content.json:
# Workspace Commitment Tier Workbook

[If you have any feedback or issues, please submit them here](https://github.com/TheAlistairRoss/MicrosoftSentinel/issues/new/choose)

parameters.name: InternalWSs
parameters.query:
SecurityIncident
| take 1
| parse IncidentUrl with * "/workspaces/" Workspace "/" *
| project Workspace

parameters.name: Subscription
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| distinct subscriptionId, location
| summarize by value = strcat("/subscriptions/", subscriptionId), label = subscriptionId, selected = iff(subscriptionId =~ '{DefaultSubscription_Internal}', true, false)
| order by value asc

parameters.name: Workspace
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ "microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces"
| project id, name, subscriptionId
| join kind = inner (
    resourcecontainers
    | where type == "microsoft.resources/subscriptions"
    | project subscriptionId, subscription = strcat(name," (",subscriptionId,")")
)
on subscriptionId
|project value = id, label = name, group = subscription

parameters.name: CurrencyCode
parameters.description: This is the currency code which your billing account should be billed / charged in
parameters.label: Currency Code

parameters.name: E5Seats
parameters.label: E5 Seats
parameters.description: Microsoft 365 E5, A5, F5, and G5 and Microsoft 365 E5, A5, F5, and G5 Security customers can get a data grant of up to 5 MB per user per day of Microsoft 365 data ingestion into Microsoft Sentinel. Enter the number of the applied licences.

parameters.name: PricingModel
parameters.description: This defaults to your current pricing model. Change this if you wish to view the pricing on the different pricing model. Note! Switching to Classic from Unified provides no benefit as you cannot downgrade the pricing model once moved.. https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sentinel-blog/introducing-the-new-microsoft-sentinel-simplified-pricing/ba-p/3869145
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| where id =~ "{Workspace}"
| project workspaceId = tolower(id), ServiceType = "Log Analytics", sku = tostring(properties.sku.name)
| union (
    resources
    | where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
    | where plan.product == "OMSGallery/SecurityInsights"
    | where properties.workspaceResourceId has "{Workspace}"
    | project workspaceId = tolower(tostring(properties.workspaceResourceId)), ServiceType = "Sentinel", sku = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.name))
    ) 
| extend Packed = pack_dictionary(ServiceType, sku)
| summarize ServiceTypes = make_list(ServiceType), Values = make_bag(Packed) by workspaceId
| project value = iif(
    ServiceTypes has "Sentinel", 
    iif (Values.Sentinel == "Unified", "Unified", "Classic"),
    "Log Analytics" 
    )
| extend
    label = value, 
    selected = true
| project value, label, selected

parameters.name: WorkspaceLocation
parameters.query:
resources
| where id == "{Workspace:id}"
| project location
| extend selected = true

parameters.name: LogAnalyticsCurrentTier
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces' 
| where id has "{Workspace}"
| extend logAnalyticsSku   = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.name))
| project logAnalyticsTier = case(
    logAnalyticsSku =~ "pergb2018", "Pay-as-you-go",
    logAnalyticsSku == "CapacityReservation", tostring(properties.sku.capacityReservationLevel),
    "Not Supported in this workbook"
    )

parameters.name: SentinelCurrentTier
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces' 
| where id == "{Workspace}"
| extend logAnalyticsSku   = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.name))
| project 
    workspaceId = tolower(id),
    logAnalyticsTier = case(
        logAnalyticsSku =~ "pergb2018", "Pay-as-you-go",
        logAnalyticsSku == "CapacityReservation", tostring(properties.sku.capacityReservationLevel),
        "Not Supported in this workbook"
        )
| join kind = fullouter (
resources
| where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
| where plan.product == "OMSGallery/SecurityInsights"
| where properties.workspaceResourceId has "{Workspace}"
| extend workspaceId = tolower(tostring(properties.workspaceResourceId))
| extend sentinelSku   = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.name))
) on workspaceId
| extend sentinelSku = iif(isempty(sentinelSku), "Sentinel Not Enabled", sentinelSku)
| project Tier = case(
        sentinelSku == "Unified", logAnalyticsTier,
        sentinelSku == "PerGB", "Pay-as-you-go",
        sentinelSku == "CapacityReservation", tostring(properties.sku.capacityReservationLevel),
        sentinelSku == "Sentinel Not Enabled", "Sentinel Not Enabled",
        "Not Supported in this workbook"
)

content.json:
# Help

Welcome to my Microsoft Sentinel Commitment Tier workbook. 

The aim of this workbook is to help you make an informed desicion with regards to changing commitment tiers. These changes can have a negative impact if done incorrectly, but done correctly, they will unlock additional discounts as you ingest more data into you log analytics workspace. 

> **NOTE:** This workbook is dependant on an external GitHub repository (by default) found [here](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TheAlistairRoss/MicrosoftSentinel/main/Solutions/CostManagement/Prices). This is due to the fact that the prices api for Azure cannot be looked up directly from a workbook, so they are cached in this location. All prices are checked daily and are only updated if the has been a change, usually due to the exchange rate.

This workbook performs the follow:

- Calculates your [Defender for Servers Plan 2 data ingestion Allowance](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-ca/azure/defender-for-cloud/faq-defender-for-servers#is-the-500-mb-of-free-data-ingestion-allowance-applied-per-workspace-or-per-machine-). This is worked out by calculating the number of distinct computers reporting to the workspace on a daily basis which have the *Security* solution listed in the Heartbeat table.


- Calculates your [Microsoft 365 E5, A5, F5 and G5 Allowance](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-ca/pricing/offers/sentinel-microsoft-365-offer/). This is based on a fixed value that you input for the selected period. 

- Fetches the retail price for the current month for the selected currency and Azure region.

- Applies any applicable discounts. 

- Calculates the commitment tier threshold and recommendations based on the previous values.


You need to ensure that the parameters above are set. 

- **Subscriptions**: This is the subscription where your log analytics workspace resides.
- **Workspace**: This is the Log Analytics workspace you are analysing.
- **Time Range**: This is the time period which you want to analyse in this workbook.
- **CurrencyCode**: This should be the currency which you are invoiced. Not everyone can view the billing information, so this is not looked up automatically.

The following parameters are optional:
- **Show Help**: You have already pressed this, otherwise you would not be here. This presents helpful information all throughout the workbook.
- **E5 Seats**: This is the total number of E5, A%, F5 and G5 licences purchased.
- **Input Custom Prices**: This gives you the option to input your own custom prices. This is typically used when you have additional discounts applied by Microsoft
- **Use Demo Data**: Sometimes to realise value of workbooks, you need to simulate the data. This will change all the usage queries to use a simulated data which makes the recommendation to move to the 100 GB commitment tier. This has only been designed with a workspace at the pay-as-you-go tier.

## NOTE: Input Custom Prices - If this option is selected, expand the heading immediatly below and input the values. They will default to zero, so consider saving the workbook to maintain these values.

# Intentionally hidden - URL and Query Parameters

These parameters are only used in advanced scenarios. This contain the Urls and queries used for the external data queries and are constructed based on selected parameters. They allow the correct file to be referenced from the selected repository.

Do not modify these unless you know what you are doing!

# Default Parameters

These values are always left hidden and not ammended. They are here to force the parameter to have a value, even when not used. To use these parameters. Select the Input Custom Prices parameter.

items.name: parameters - Microsoft Azure Monitor Custom Pricing - Copy
parameters - Microsoft Azure Monitor Custom Pricing - Copy

criteriaContext.resultVal: externaldata(TimeGenerated : datetime , ServiceName: string , ArmRegionName: string, CurrencyCode: string, MeterName: string, Tier: string, UnitOfMeasure: string, RetailPrice: real , EffectiveStartDate:datetime , EffectiveCommitmentTierThresholdGB:real , EffectivePricePerGB:real)[  h"{AzureMonitorPricesCSVURL}" ] with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)

externaldata(TimeGenerated : datetime , ServiceName: string , ArmRegionName: string, CurrencyCode: string, MeterName: string, Tier: string, UnitOfMeasure: string, RetailPrice: real , EffectiveStartDate:datetime , EffectiveCommitmentTierThresholdGB:real , EffectivePricePerGB:real)[  h"{SentinelPricesCSVURL}" ] with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)

parameters.name: ApplyDefenderAllowanceToUpdateTables
parameters.query:
resources
| take 1
| project JoinColumn = 1
| join kind = fullouter(
    resources
    | where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
    | where plan.product == "OMSGallery/Updates"
    | where properties.workspaceResourceId has "{Workspace}"
    | project id, configurations = properties.configurations
    | extend JoinColumn = 1
)   on JoinColumn
| extend Result = case(
    isempty(id), "true",
    array_length(configurations) > 0, "true",
    "false"
)
|project Result

criteriaContext.resultVal: let BasicTables = toscalar(print Basic = "{BasicTables}"| extend Basic = split(substring(Basic, 1,strlen(Basic)-2), ',')); let E5Seats = {E5Seats}; let E5AllowancePerDayMB = E5Seats * 5; let E5Tables = dynamic([{E5Tables}]); let E5Usage = Usage     | where StartTime >= TimeRangeStart and StartTime <= TimeRangeEnd     | where IsBillable == true     | where DataType in (E5Tables)     | make-series Quantity = sum(Quantity) default = 0 on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to TimeRangeEnd step 1d     | mv-expand Quantity to typeof(long), StartTime to typeof(datetime)     | extend E5ReductionMB = iff(E5AllowancePerDayMB - Quantity > 0, Quantity, E5AllowancePerDayMB)     | project StartTime, E5ReductionMB; let DefenderForCloudPerDeviceAllowanceMB = 500; let DefenderForCloudTables = dynamic([{DefenderForCloudTables}]); let DefenderForCloudUpdateTables = dynamic(["Update", "UpdateSummary"]); let DefenderForCloudUsage = Heartbeat     | where TimeGenerated >= TimeRangeStart and TimeGenerated <= TimeRangeEnd     | where Solutions has "\"security\""     | make-series DeviceCount = dcount(SourceComputerId, 4) default = 0 on TimeGenerated from TimeRangeStart to TimeRangeEnd step 1d     | mv-expand DeviceCount to typeof(int), TimeGenerated to typeof(datetime)     | extend DefenderForCloudAllowancePerDayMB = DefenderForCloudPerDeviceAllowanceMB * DeviceCount     | project TimeGenerated, DefenderForCloudAllowancePerDayMB     | join kind = rightouter (Usage         | where StartTime >= TimeRangeStart and StartTime <= TimeRangeEnd         | where IsBillable == true         | where DataType in (DefenderForCloudTables)         | make-series Quantity = sum(Quantity) default = 0 on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to TimeRangeEnd step 1d         | mv-expand Quantity to typeof(long), StartTime to typeof(datetime))         on $left.TimeGenerated == $right.StartTime     | extend DefenderForCloudReductionMB = iff(DefenderForCloudAllowancePerDayMB - Quantity > 0, Quantity, DefenderForCloudAllowancePerDayMB)     | project StartTime, DefenderForCloudReductionMB; let UsageMetrics =  Usage     | where StartTime >= TimeRangeStart and StartTime <= TimeRangeEnd     | where IsBillable == true     | where '*' == BasicTables[0] or DataType !in (BasicTables)     | make-series kind=nonempty QuantityMB = sum(Quantity) default = 0 on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to TimeRangeEnd step 1d     | mv-expand QuantityMB to typeof(long), StartTime to typeof(datetime)     | join kind = leftouter (E5Usage) on StartTime     | join kind = leftouter (DefenderForCloudUsage) on StartTime     | project StartTime, QuantityMB, DefenderForCloudReductionMB, E5ReductionMB     | extend JoinColumn = 1;

content.json:
# Custom Prices

By default, this workbook calculates the cost based on the retail price for the relevant meters for the current month. Depending on your agreement with Microsoft, you may have discounts that are applicable. 

This input gives you the ability to input a fixed price for the selected sku, or a percentage reduction off the retail price for the selected sku. 

## Fixed Prices
If your discounts are a fixed value, change the parameter "*Fixed or Percentage*" to "**Fixed**" then enter the value as provided on your agreement. E.g. Pay-as-you-go = 2.35 - This would mean that you would pay 2.35 for the selected meter in your selected currency.

## Percentage
If your discounts are a percentage reduction, change the parameter "*Fixed or Percentage*" to "**Percentage**" then select the value from the drop down as provided on your agreement. E.g. Pay-as-you-go = 20 - This would mean you would be charged the retail price minus 20% for your region and currency.

> **Note:** Your agreements may be specific to regions, ensure that you have entered the correct values.

> If you do not need to use custom prices, ensure you switch the parameter "*Input Custom Prices*" to "**No**" at the top of this workbook

items.name: text - Input Custom Prices - Help Message

content.query:
resources 
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| where id =~ "{Workspace}" 
| extend workspaceId = tolower(id)
| extend logAnalyticsSku   = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.name))
| extend logAnalyticsSkuUpdate = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.lastSkuUpdate))
| extend logAnalyticsTier = case(logAnalyticsSku =~ "pergb2018", "Pay-as-you-go", "Free, PerNode and Standalone not supported in this workbook")
| join kind = leftouter(
    resources 
    | where type =~ "microsoft.operationsmanagement/solutions"
    | where plan.product == "OMSGallery/SecurityInsights"
    | where properties.workspaceResourceId startswith "{Workspace}"
    | extend workspaceId = tolower(tostring(properties.workspaceResourceId))
    | extend sentinelEnabled = true
    | extend sentinelSku   = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.name)), sentinelSkuUpdate = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.lastSkuUpdate))
    | extend sentinelTier = case(sentinelSku == "Unified", "Pay-as-you-go", sentinelSku == "PerGB", "Pay-as-you-go", sentinelSku == "CapacityReservation", tostring(properties.sku.capacityReservationLevel), "Not Supported in this workbook")
    | project workspaceId, sentinelEnabled, sentinelSku, sentinelTier, sentinelSkuUpdate
    )
    on workspaceId
| extend sentinelEnabled = iif(isnotnull(sentinelEnabled), true, false)
| extend sentinelSku  = iif(strlen(sentinelSku) > 0, sentinelSku, "")
| project workspaceId, logAnalyticsSku, logAnalyticsTier,sentinelEnabled, sentinelSku, sentinelTier
content.title: Workspace Details

content.json:
# Commitment Tier Recommendations

This table view displays the current tiers for Microsoft Sentinel. It shows the optimal tier to be on based on the selected time range. It does this by calculating the total cost at each tier and returns the cost for the current tier and the lowest price tier in the selected time range. 

Because of this, the recommended tier may not always be the most optimal if you have recently made changes to data ingestion, such as increasing or decreasing. Always review the charts page

items.name: text - Unified - Overview - Commitment Tier Recommendations

content.query:
let TimeRangeStart = startofday(todatetime({TimeRange:start}), 1);
let TimeRangeEnd = endofday(todatetime({TimeRange:end}), -1);
let PricingModel = "{PricingModel}";
let SentinelCurrentTier = "{SentinelCurrentTier}";
let LogAnalyticsCurrentTier = "{LogAnalyticsCurrentTier}";
let SentinelPriceInputs = {SentinelPrices};
let LogAnalyticsPriceInputs = {AzureMonitorPrices};
let PriceInputs = union SentinelPriceInputs, LogAnalyticsPriceInputs 
    | extend TierVolumeGB = iif(Tier == "Pay-as-you-go", 0, toint(Tier))     
    | project ServiceName, Tier, TierVolumeGB, SkuPrice, SkuEffectivePricePerGB  
    | extend JoinColumn = 1;   
{UsageMetrics} 
let TierStats = 
    UsageMetrics  
    | join kind = inner (PriceInputs) 
        on JoinColumn  
    | extend DefenderForCloudReductionGB = column_ifexists("DefenderForCloudReductionMB", QuantityMB) / 1e3
    | extend E5ReductionGB = column_ifexists("E5ReductionMB", QuantityMB) / 1e3
    | extend QuantityGB = QuantityMB / 1e3
    | extend QuantityGB = case(
        ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"), QuantityGB - E5ReductionGB - DefenderForCloudReductionGB, 
        QuantityGB - E5ReductionGB
    )
    | extend CostAtTier = iff(QuantityGB > TierVolumeGB or Tier == "Pay-as-you-go", QuantityGB * SkuEffectivePricePerGB, SkuPrice)  
    | summarize CostAtTier = sum(CostAtTier), QuantityGB = sum(QuantityGB) by Tier, ServiceName  
    | extend
        CostAtTier = CostAtTier, 
        QuantityGB = QuantityGB
    | extend JoinColumn = 1;
TierStats
| where (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and Tier == SentinelCurrentTier and PricingModel in ("Unified", "Classic")) or (ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" and Tier == LogAnalyticsCurrentTier and PricingModel in ("Classic", "Log Analytics"))
| join kind = inner(TierStats
    | summarize arg_min(CostAtTier, Tier, JoinColumn) by ServiceName)
    on ServiceName
| extend Status = case(
                      Tier == Tier1,
                      "Good",
                      "Change Tier"
                  )
| project-rename 
    CurrentTier = Tier,
    RecommendedTier = Tier1,
    CurrentTierCost = CostAtTier,
    RecommendedTierCost = CostAtTier1
| extend CostDifference = RecommendedTierCost - CurrentTierCost
| project
    ServiceName,
    CurrentTier,
    RecommendedTier,
    Status,
    QuantityGB,
    CurrentTierCost,
    RecommendedTierCost,
    CostDifference
content.title: Commitment Tier Recommendations

tooltipFormat.tooltip: This is your current estimated costs
This is the potential cost if the tier is changed

items.name: query - Unified - Overview - Commitment Tier Recommendations

content.query:
let TimeRangeStart = startofday(todatetime({TimeRange:start}), 1);
let TimeRangeEnd = endofday(todatetime({TimeRange:end}), -1);
let PricingModel = "{PricingModel}";
let SentinelCurrentTier = "{SentinelCurrentTier}";
let LogAnalyticsCurrentTier = "{LogAnalyticsCurrentTier}";
{UsageMetrics}  
UsageMetrics
| extend ServiceName = dynamic(["Azure Monitor", "Sentinel"])
| mv-expand ServiceName to typeof(string)
| summarize
    QuantityMB = sum(QuantityMB),
    DefenderForCloudReductionMB = sum(DefenderForCloudReductionMB),
    E5ReductionMB = sum(E5ReductionMB)
    by ServiceName
| extend QuantityGB = QuantityMB / 1e3
| extend BillableQuantityGB = case(
                                  ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"),
                                  (QuantityMB - DefenderForCloudReductionMB - E5ReductionMB) / 1e3, 
                                  (QuantityMB - E5ReductionMB) / 1e3
                              )
| extend DefenderForCloudReductionGB = iff(
                                           ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"),
                                           DefenderForCloudReductionMB / 1e3, 
                                           toreal(0)
                                       )
| extend E5ReductionGB = E5ReductionMB / 1e3
| where (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel in ("Unified", "Classic")) or (ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" and PricingModel in ("Classic", "Log Analytics"))
| project
    ServiceName,
    QuantityGB = QuantityGB,
    BillableQuantityGB = BillableQuantityGB,
    DefenderForCloudReductionGB = DefenderForCloudReductionGB,
    E5ReductionGB = E5ReductionGB
| extend
    TotalReduction = DefenderForCloudReductionGB + E5ReductionGB,
    Message = iif(ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel != "Unified", "Defender For Cloud 500MB per server/day only applicable to Microsoft Sentinel on the new Unified pricing model","")
content.title: Ingestion and Allowances

items.name: query - Unified - Overview - Ingestion and Allowances

content.json:
# DEMO DATA
## This workbook is currently displaying usage data for demonstration purposes. Ensure you turn this parameter off in production

items.name: text - Main Page - Demo Data Warning - Copy

content.json:
# Commitment Tier Parameters

These charts require the selection of the Commitment tier parameter. By default, the current tier is selected. With the unified pricing model, this tier selection displays the combined price of Log Analytics and Microsoft Sentinel. 

> TIP: You can select all the tiers at once, but it is recommend to select your current tier, the recommended tier and at least one other (the next one up or down). For example if your current tier is 100 and the recommend tier is 200, select 100, 200 and 300. Check the Overview page for the current recommendation based on your selected time range.

- Details for changing Microsoft Sentinel Commitment Tiers: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sentinel/billing-reduce-costs#set-or-change-pricing-tier

### All prices shown are based on the current retail prices. This does not account for any discounts you may have been provided. This has been provided as a guide into your data and converted to cost, as opposed to just data ingested

### This workbook has not been tested against any legacy tiers for Log Analytics or dedicated clusters.

parameters.name: SentinelCT
parameters.label: Sentinel Commitment Tier
parameters.query:
resources
| take 1
| project value = dynamic(["Pay-as-you-go","100","200","300","400","500","1000","2000","5000"])
| mvexpand with_itemindex = Order value to typeof(string)
| extend selected = iff("{SentinelCurrentTier}" == value, true, false)
| project value, label = value, selected, Order
| order by Order asc

parameters.name: LogAnalyticsCT
parameters.label: Log Analytics Commitment Tier
parameters.query:
resources
| take 1
| project value = dynamic(["Pay-as-you-go","100","200","300","400","500","1000","2000","5000"])
| mvexpand with_itemindex = Order value to typeof(string)
| extend selected = iff("{LogAnalyticsCurrentTier}" == value, true, false)
| project value, label = value, selected, Order
| order by Order asc

content.json:
# Charts Color Coding

Each Tier shown in the charts should be color coded as per the below legend. (All except for the forecasting charts which only show one tier at a time)

# Sum of Daily Costs

This chart show the retail cost for Microsoft Sentinel based on the selected commitment tiers and current usage. 

For example if you change the parameter **Sentinel Commitment Tier** to *Pay-as-you-go* and *500*, the chart would display two series for each selected tier. Each series would reflect the retail prices that would have been paid based on the selected tiers.

When trying to interpret these costs , the legend shows the total cost for the selected time range, with the most expensive tier on the left and the best value on the right.

criteriaContext.resultVal: let TimeRangeStart = startofday(todatetime({TimeRange:start}),1); let TimeRangeEnd = endofday(todatetime({TimeRange:end}),-1); let PricingModel = "{PricingModel}"; {UsageMetrics} UsageMetrics | join kind = inner (     PriceInputs     | where Tier in (SelectedTiers)     )     on JoinColumn | project-away JoinColumn, JoinColumn1 | extend DefenderForCloudReductionGB = column_ifexists("DefenderForCloudReductionMB", QuantityMB) / 1e3 | extend DefenderForCloudReductionGB = iff(ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"), DefenderForCloudReductionGB, toreal(0)) | extend E5ReductionGB = column_ifexists("E5ReductionMB", QuantityMB) / 1e3 | extend QuantityGB = QuantityMB / 1e3 | extend BillableQuantityGB = QuantityGB - E5ReductionGB - DefenderForCloudReductionGB | extend CostAtTier = iff(BillableQuantityGB > TierVolumeGB, BillableQuantityGB * SkuEffectivePricePerGB, SkuPrice) | make-series CostAtTier = sum(CostAtTier), BillableQuantityGB = sum(BillableQuantityGB) on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to TimeRangeEnd step 1d by Tier | extend MovingAverageFilter = iif(array_length(CostAtTier) < 7, array_length(CostAtTier), 7) | extend CostMovingAverage = series_fir(CostAtTier, repeat(1, MovingAverageFilter), true, false) | extend BillableQuantityGBMovingAverage = series_fir(BillableQuantityGB, repeat(1, MovingAverageFilter), true, false) | render timechart

let TimeRangeStart = startofday(todatetime({TimeRange:start}),1); let TimeRangeEnd = endofday(todatetime({TimeRange:end}),-1); let PricingModel = "{PricingModel}"; {UsageMetrics} let Actual_Usage_GB =      UsageMetrics     | extend DefenderForCloudReductionGB = column_ifexists("DefenderForCloudReductionMB", QuantityMB) / 1e3     | extend DefenderForCloudReductionGB = iff(ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"), DefenderForCloudReductionGB, toreal(0))     | extend E5ReductionGB = column_ifexists("E5ReductionMB", QuantityMB) / 1e3     | extend QuantityGB = QuantityMB / 1e3     | extend BillableQuantityGB = QuantityGB - E5ReductionGB - DefenderForCloudReductionGB     | make-series BillableQuantityGB = toreal(round(sum(BillableQuantityGB),3)) default = toreal(0) on StartTime step 1d      | project          SeriesName = "Actual_Usage_GB",         StartTime,         BillableQuantityGB; let Average_Usage_GB =      Actual_Usage_GB     | extend Stats = series_stats_dynamic(BillableQuantityGB)     | project         SeriesName = "Average_Usage_GB",         StartTime,         BillableQuantityGB = repeat(toreal(Stats.avg), array_length(BillableQuantityGB)) ; let UsageTimeRange =     toscalar(Actual_Usage_GB     | project StartTime); let CommitmentTierCalculations = PriceInputs     | extend StartTime = UsageTimeRange     | extend BillableQuantityGB = repeat(toreal(SkuEffectiveCommitmentTierThreshold), array_length(StartTime))     | project          SeriesName = tostring(Tier),          StartTime,          BillableQuantityGB ; union CommitmentTierCalculations, Actual_Usage_GB, Average_Usage_GB | render timechart

let PricingModel = "{PricingModel}"; let TimeRangeStart = startofday(todatetime({TimeRange:start}), 1); let TimeRangeEnd = endofday(todatetime({TimeRange:end}), -1); {UsageMetrics}   UsageMetrics | extend DefenderForCloudReductionGB = column_ifexists("DefenderForCloudReductionMB", QuantityMB) / 1e3 | extend DefenderForCloudReductionGB = iff(ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"), DefenderForCloudReductionGB, toreal(0)) | extend E5ReductionGB = column_ifexists("E5ReductionMB", QuantityMB) / 1e3 | extend QuantityGB = QuantityMB / 1e3 | extend BillableQuantityGB =  QuantityGB - E5ReductionGB - DefenderForCloudReductionGB | project StartTime, BillableQuantityGB, DefenderForCloudReductionGB, E5ReductionGB

content.title: Sum of Daily Sentinel Cost ({CurrencyCode})
Sum of Daily Log Analytics Cost ({CurrencyCode})

items.name: query - Classic - Charts - Azure Monitor Logs Ingestion

content.json:
# Moving Average Costs

This chart show the moving average costs for Microsoft Sentinel based on the selected commitment tiers and current usage. 

In statistics, a moving average is a calculation to analyze data points by creating a series of averages of different subsets of the full data set. This is used in this example to smooth out short term fluctuations in the data and to highlight weekly trends

For example if you change the parameter **Sentinel Commitment Tier** to *Pay-as-you-go* and *500*, the chart would display two series for each selected tier. Each series would reflect the moving averages cost based on the selected tiers.

content.json:
# GB Ingested and Thresholds

This chart show the actual and average ingestion of billable data for Microsoft Sentinel. It also visualises the thresholds which the selected commitment tiers become cost effective. 


For example if you change the parameter **Sentinel Commitment Tier** to *Pay-as-you-go* and *500*, the chart would display two series for each selected tier. It would also display two series called *"Actual_Usage_GB"* and *"Average_Usage_GB"*

If the Actual_Usage_GB and / or Average_Usage_GB is higher than a displayed commitment tier, then it would be highly likely that moving to the next tier would be cost effective.

content.json:
# GB Pricing Forecasted

These charts show the current ingestion cost the forecasted ingestion costs based of billable data for Microsoft Sentinel. It also visualises the thresholds which the selected commitment tiers become cost effective. 

These charts require you to select the Microsoft Sentinel tiers that will be displayed for forecasting. By default the current tier will be selected.

You are also required to select a value from the parameter **Days Forecasted**.

When making forecasting predictions, the more data you have historically, the more accurate the forecasting is. It is also worth noting the further in the future the data goes, the less accurate the prediction is.

When observing these charts, you will see two series. 
- **CostAtTier**: This represents the current cost based on the pricing unputs and current usage. At the end of the selected time range, it will drop to 0.
- **Forecasted**: This reflects the trend of data, with anomalous data samples removed. This is why it does not match the *CostAtTier* series exactly. At the end of the selected time range, it will continue further for the number of days selected in the parameter **Days Forecasted**, providing a calculated prection of the data based on historcal data.

>Note: Forecasting cannot predict for unexpected changes that have not happened regularlly in the historical data, such as onboarding of new data sources. Also if seasonality cannot be detected (This means regular patterns, such as peaks and troughs in the data relating to user working hours), then it will display a line of best fit.

parameters.name: DaysInFuture
parameters.label: Days Forecasted

parameters.name: SentinelSelectedForecastTier
parameters.label: Sentinel Tier
parameters.query:
resources
| take 1
| project value = dynamic(["Pay-as-you-go","100","200","300","400","500","1000","2000","5000"])
| mvexpand with_itemindex = Order value to typeof(string)
| extend selected = iff("{SentinelCurrentTier}" == value, true, false)
| project value, label = value, selected, Order
| order by Order asc

parameters.name: LogAnalyticsSelectedForecastTier
parameters.label: Azure Monitor Logs Tier
parameters.query:
resources
| take 1
| project value = dynamic(["Pay-as-you-go","100","200","300","400","500","1000","2000","5000"])
| mvexpand with_itemindex = Order value to typeof(string)
| extend selected = iff("{LogAnalyticsCurrentTier}" == value, true, false)
| project value, label = value, selected, Order
| order by Order asc

criteriaContext.resultVal: let TimeRangeStart = startofday(todatetime({TimeRange:start}),1); let TimeRangeEnd = endofday(todatetime({TimeRange:end}),-1); let DaysForecastedPastEnd = {DaysInFuture}; let PricingModel = "{PricingModel}"; {UsageMetrics} UsageMetrics | extend DefenderForCloudReductionGB = column_ifexists("DefenderForCloudReductionMB", QuantityMB) / 1e3 | extend DefenderForCloudReductionGB = iff(ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"), DefenderForCloudReductionGB, toreal(0)) | extend E5ReductionGB = column_ifexists("E5ReductionMB", QuantityMB) / 1e3 | extend QuantityGB = QuantityMB / 1e3 | extend BillableQuantityGB = QuantityGB - E5ReductionGB - DefenderForCloudReductionGB | make-series BillableQuantityGB = sum(BillableQuantityGB) on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to datetime_add('Day', DaysForecastedPastEnd, TimeRangeEnd) step 1d  | extend BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted = series_decompose_forecast(BillableQuantityGB, DaysForecastedPastEnd, -1,'avg') | render timechart | mv-expand     BillableQuantityGB to typeof(real),     BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted to typeof(real),     StartTime to typeof(datetime) | extend JoinColumn = 1 | join kind = inner (     PriceInputs     )     on JoinColumn | project StartTime, BillableQuantityGB, Tier, BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted, TierVolumeGB, SkuEffectivePricePerGB, SkuPrice | extend CostAtTier = iif(BillableQuantityGB > TierVolumeGB or Tier == "Pay-as-you-go", toreal(BillableQuantityGB * SkuEffectivePricePerGB), toreal(SkuPrice)) | extend CostAtTier_Forecasted = iff(BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted > TierVolumeGB or Tier == "Pay-as-you-go", toreal(BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted * SkuEffectivePricePerGB), toreal(SkuPrice)) | make-series CostAtTier = any(CostAtTier), Forecasted = any(CostAtTier_Forecasted) on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to datetime_add('Day', DaysForecastedPastEnd, TimeRangeEnd) step 1d  | render timechart

let TimeRangeStart = startofday(todatetime({TimeRange:start}),1); let TimeRangeEnd = endofday(todatetime({TimeRange:end}),-1); let PricingModel = "{PricingModel}"; let DaysForecastedPastEnd = {DaysInFuture}; {UsageMetrics} UsageMetrics | extend DefenderForCloudReductionGB = column_ifexists("DefenderForCloudReductionMB", QuantityMB) / 1e3 | extend DefenderForCloudReductionGB = iff(ServiceName == "Azure Monitor" or (ServiceName == "Sentinel" and PricingModel == "Unified"), DefenderForCloudReductionGB, toreal(0)) | extend E5ReductionGB = column_ifexists("E5ReductionMB", QuantityMB) / 1e3 | extend QuantityGB = QuantityMB / 1e3 | extend BillableQuantityGB = QuantityGB - E5ReductionGB - DefenderForCloudReductionGB | make-series BillableQuantityGB = sum(BillableQuantityGB) on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to datetime_add('Day', DaysForecastedPastEnd, TimeRangeEnd) step 1d  | extend BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted = series_decompose_forecast(BillableQuantityGB, DaysForecastedPastEnd, -1,'avg') | render timechart | mv-expand     BillableQuantityGB to typeof(real),     BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted to typeof(real),     StartTime to typeof(datetime) | extend JoinColumn = 1 | join kind = inner (     PriceInputs     )     on JoinColumn | project StartTime, BillableQuantityGB, Tier, BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted, TierVolumeGB, SkuEffectivePricePerGB, SkuPrice | extend CostAtTier = iif(BillableQuantityGB > TierVolumeGB or Tier == "Pay-as-you-go", toreal(BillableQuantityGB * SkuEffectivePricePerGB), toreal(SkuPrice)) | extend CostAtTier_Forecasted = iff(BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted > TierVolumeGB or Tier == "Pay-as-you-go", toreal(BillableQuantityGB_Forecasted * SkuEffectivePricePerGB), toreal(SkuPrice)) | make-series CostAtTier = any(CostAtTier), Forecasted = any(CostAtTier_Forecasted) on StartTime from TimeRangeStart to datetime_add('Day', DaysForecastedPastEnd, TimeRangeEnd) step 1d  | extend CostAtTier = series_fir(CostAtTier, repeat(1, 7), true, false) | extend Forecasted = series_fir(Forecasted, repeat(1, 7), true, false) | render timechart

content.json:
This troubleshooting guide takes you through the steps for resolving the external pricing data. For all other issues, ensure you have read access to you Azure Log Analytics workspace were Microsoft Sentinel resides.

Read access is also required to Microsoft Sentinel, if the workspace is enabled with Microsoft Sentinel.

This troubleshooting table displays the following information

- **ServiceName** : This will either be "Azure Monitor" or "Sentinel". 
	- If you are expecting Sentinel to be display and it is not, review your permissions.


- **PricingModel** :This will be either "Unified",  "Classic" or "Log Analytics"
	- **Unified** will show if you have a Microsoft Sentinel enabled workspace on the [new pricing model](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-sentinel-blog/introducing-the-new-microsoft-sentinel-simplified-pricing/ba-p/3869145#:~:text=We%20are%20excited%20to%20announce%20the%20new%20simplified,is%20rolling%20out%20for%20all%20regions%20throughout%20July.).
	- **Classic** will show if you have not moved to the new pricing model.
	- **Log Analytics** will show if Microsoft Sentinel is not enabled on your workspace **OR** you do not have read permissions to the SecurityInsights solution.


- **CurrencyCode**: This is your selected currency code. The currency codes are as per the [supported currencies](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/cost-management/retail-prices/azure-retail-prices#supported-currencies).


- **ArmRegionName**: This should be the Azure Region name for your Log Analytics Workspace.


- **IsData**: This validates that the data can be loaded with the [External Data](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-explorer/kusto/query/externaldata-operator?pivots=azuremonitor) function.


- **Url**: This is the url for the repository where the pricing will be looked up from. You should be able to follow the link and view the raw CSV. 

If the url does not work, identify the fault (if possible) or submit an issue [here](https://github.com/TheAlistairRoss/MicrosoftSentinel/issues). Ensure you provide all the details shown in the table below.

If the results shows a warning message, this may suggests that the external data query has not been loaded as the url is incorrect or the file is inaccessible. Identify which URL is failing. This can be done by observing the **IsData** column and looking for those that are **False**. If possible, try and identify the issue and submit all the details from the table [here](https://github.com/TheAlistairRoss/MicrosoftSentinel/issues).

content.query:
let sentinelData = {SentinelExternalData};
let azureMonitorData = {AzureMonitorExternalData};
let currencyCode = "{CurrencyCode}";
let armRegionName = "{WorkspaceLocation}";
let Service = dynamic([{"ServiceName": "Sentinel", "Url" : "{SentinelPricesCSVURL}"},{"ServiceName": "Azure Monitor", "Url" : "{AzureMonitorPricesCSVURL}"}]);
let externalDataTest = union azureMonitorData, sentinelData
    | distinct ServiceName
    | extend IsData = true;
print
    ServiceName = Service,
    CurrencyCode = currencyCode,
    ArmRegionName = armRegionName 
| mvexpand ServiceName
 | evaluate bag_unpack(ServiceName)
| join kind=fullouter (externalDataTest) on ServiceName
| project-away ServiceName1
| extend IsData = iif(IsData == true, true, false)
| extend PricingModel = "{PricingModel}"
| extend Info = "info"
| order by ServiceName asc
| project Info, ServiceName, PricingModel, CurrencyCode, ArmRegionName, IsData, Url
content.title: URL Details

tooltipFormat.tooltip: One of the valid billed currencies "USD", "AUD", "BRL", "CAD", "CHF", "CNY", "DKK", "EUR", "GBP", "INR", "JPY", "KRW", "NOK", "NZD", "RUB", "SEK", "TWD"

content.json:
# Azure Monitor Data

This should show the data from the URL above. This verifies the data is successfully imported using the following ExternalData query:

```{AzureMonitorPrices}```

> If the results shows a warning message, this may suggests that the external data query has not been loaded as the url is incorrect or the file is inaccessible.

items.name: text - Unified - Troubleshooting - External Data Help - Copy
